metadata.title: CVE-2017-15018 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: LAME 3.99.5, 3.99.4, 3.99.3, 3.99.2, 3.99.1, 3.99, 3.98.4, 3.98.2 and 3.98 have a heap-based buffer over-read when handling a malformed file in k_34_4 in vbrquantize.c. It was discovered that LAME incorrectly handled certain audio files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or possibly other unspecified impact.

criterions.comment: lame package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.100-2').
